intro: Pyrola alba, commonly known as the white wintergreen, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky slopes. Its flowers bloom in late winter or early spring, making it one of the first flowering plants of the year. Pyrola alba is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators in early spring.
